row_1: The following table presents cost of revenues, including TAC (in millions, except percentages):

row_5: Cost of revenues as a percentage of revenues

row_1: Cost of revenues increased $15.3 billion from 2021 to 2022. The increase was due to an increase in TAC and other cost of revenues and TAC.

row_2: The increase in TAC from 2021 to 2022 was due in part to an increase in the other cost of revenues related to Google Network partners, primarily driven by growth in revenues subject to TAC. The TAC rate was 22% in both 2021 and 2022. The Google Network partners' costs as well as hardware costs.

row_3: The increase in other cost of revenues was due to an increase in R&D expenses, primarily due to increases in data center costs and other operations costs as well as hardware costs.
